content:

comments.content:
Maybe it’s a StuffIt archive. These usually have the extension “.sit”, but maybe the t got cut off. Try adding the t at the end. The Finder may ask if you are sure you want to do this—you do. The icon should turn into a StuffIt icon. You should be able to just double-click on it to un-stuff the font.

If it’s not a StuffIt archive, I don’t know what it is.

OHH yes im sorry it is ” .sit ” but it wont let me do anything with it when i click on it from the desktop where it put it..... it says  
“there is no defalt application specifies to open the document .sit ” ...... what do i do ?

Make sure you have the _( free )_ StuffIt Expander installed on your Mac..

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109095838/http:/www.formlos.net/)
You can get a free limited-time demo [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109095838/http:/www.digitalriver.com/dr/v2/ec_dynamic.main?SP=1&PN=14&sid=52277)
StuffIt Expander is free, not a limited-time demo. You don’t need StuffIt Deluxe just to open StuffIt files.
As far as I’m concerned, if you could get along without Stuffit Deluxe altogether, you’d be better off. Allume Systems, the successor to Aladdin Systems, really made a hash of v9 for PC...
I’m perfectly perfectly happy with my old Aladdin Stuffit Deluxe.
